content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the solution in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(str, text_width = 10)
    words = split(str, " ")
    new_lines = []
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line * " " * word) > text_width
            push!(new_lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    
    push!(new_lines, current_line)  # add the last line to new_lines
    
    return join(new_lines, "\n")   # convert array of strings into a single string with newline characters between each element
end
```

For example:
```julia
println(wrap_string("This is some text which needs to be wrapped.", 10))
```
Output:
```
This is
some text
which needs
to be
wrapped.
```
